catalog_info.title: Meanings as Species: Seminar
catalog_info.description: We will develop an analogy between linguistic entities (words, meanings) and biological entities (population lineages, species).  The goal is to give an account  that acknowledges  what is correct in Quine’s criticisms of analyticity and reference determinacy while giving the notion of meaning a descriptive and explanatory role.  Seminar participants need to have philosophical sophistication; they need not have extensive knowledge of the philosophy of language or the philosophy of biology.
